page.title: 18Billingham's Nature Reserve
page.content: Charlton's Pond used to be Cowpen Brickworks but somuch clay was dug out that it flooded. William Charlton leased the pond and stocked it with 250 Lochleven trout and fished it with his friends. In 1968 Charlton's Pond was made a nature reserve. Altogether 112 different kinds of birds have been seen there. The habitat for the birds is water surrounded by hawthorn and elder bushes which provide food for wintering thrushes from Scandinavia. The eastern end is fenced off to protect breeding birds. There are lots of ducks, moorhens, 2 swans and mallards. In the pond are carp, tench,minnow and stickleback. Many local people like to fish at the pond because it is well stocked and easy to get at.
